Properties.Name: Text
Properties.Value:
This Workflow syncs customers from HubSpot CRM to Xero. 
It retrieves contacts from HubSpot, checks if each exists in a key-value store, and if not, maps and formats the data, then creates the customer in Xero. 
Successes and errors are logged accordingly.

Nodes.Name: VariableBar
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are setting the Group for Key Values

Nodes.Name: Formatter
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we display a message if the Customer ID has been found in the Key Values

Properties.Name: Expression
Properties.Value: Customer ID: "{CustomerID}" has already been processed.

Nodes.Name: SetKeyValue2
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here we are logging the Key Value record for successful records.
We get the Group from the Variable bar.
We use the Customer ID as the Key (Notice the fx on the input - you need to select which field in the payload is the Key.)
We use the ContactID GUID as the Value

Nodes.Name: HubSpotCrm
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are retrieving a list of HubSpot Customers limited to 5 for this sample Workflow

Properties.Description: Read a page of contacts. Control what is returned via the `properties` query param.
Properties.Name: Name

Properties.Description: The maximum number of results to display per page.
Properties.Name: limit

Nodes.Name: ForEach
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we split the full Customer List from HubSpot into individual customer records

Nodes.Name: GetKeyValue2
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we check to see if the Customer ID has been processed before by checking if a Key Value record has already been logged for this Customer ID.

Nodes.Name: Formatter
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are building the Source Payload for the QuickMap by encapsulating the Item Payload from the For Each Node into a Customer Object

Nodes.Name: QuickMap
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we map the customer data retrieved from HubSpot to the required Xero format before creating the customer record.

Nodes.Name: ForEach
Nodes.LongDescription: Here are encapsulating the Contact object within an array to ensure it is accepted as a valid request payload by Xero.

Nodes.Name: Xero
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here we are creating the Contact record in Xero.
A 200 Response Code indicates successful customer creation.

Properties.Name: Description
Properties.Value: Allows you to create a multiple contacts (bulk) in a Xero organisation

Properties.Name: summarizeErrors
Properties.Value: If false return 200 OK and mix of successfully created obejcts and any with validation errors

Nodes.Name: IfVisualBasic
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here we are checking if the Customer was created successfully in Xero by validating the Response Code.

A successful records contains a 200 Response Code
A failed record will contain an error message within the Response

Nodes.Name: SetKeyValue2
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here we are logging the Key Value record for error records.
We get the Group from the Variable bar.
We use the Customer ID as the Key (Notice the fx on the input - you need to select which field in the payload is the Key.)
We use the Xero Response error message as the Value.

Name: HubSpot to Xero Customers
Description: This Workflow syncs Customers from HubSpot CRM to Xero. It retrieves contacts from HubSpot, verifies their existence in a key-value store, and for new entries, maps and formats the data before creating the customer in Xero, logging both successes and errors along the way.
